intro: Caucaea tarquiensis, commonly known as the Tarquiensis caucaea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests. Its leaves are usually elliptical with a smooth surface and dark green coloration. Caucaea tarquiensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
